thread.title: Live updates: Will Muschamp reviews Arkansas loss, previews Ole Miss
thread.title_full: Live updates: Will Muschamp reviews Arkansas loss, previews Ole Miss

author: Brandon Marcello | bmarcello@al.com
title: Live updates: Will Muschamp reviews Arkansas loss, previews Ole Miss
text:
Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp will meet with the media at 5:30 p.m. CT. 
- "No consolation prize after a loss," says Muschamp. 
-- He liked the way the team responded from 14-0 deficit. 
-- "Extremely gut-wrenching for them." 
-- Auburn did not go on the field today because of the length of the four-overtime game. 
-- "Every week is a season and you have to realize it and approach it that way." 
-- "We've made some improvements and we have to continue to move that direction." 
-- ON execution on third and fourth downs: "Just some things you coach on the film. This is how we can play it better, make a call here or there." Have to be very technical with players in preparations and correct mistakes. Several games have come down to one or two drives this season. "You've got to make great decisions in those games to win the games." 
-- On Carlton Davis taking loss hard: "It's a collection of plays. ... I wish we had a lot more like Carlton, tough, competitive, football instincts." 
-- Defense particularly well: "I think we've improved" against the run. 
-- Feel like unit has enough emotional investment? "I do. I'm complimenting a player that it's obviously really, really important to him" to win. 
-- One Ole Miss: "They play with great tempo." Great run, pass options and great speed and options on the outside. 
--- "We've got to get off blocks, disengage" and make tackles. 
-- Biggest inhibitors: "Get off a block and make a play." 
-- "I don't think you can get anything out of a loss." 
-- Ole Miss' offensive line with Laremy Tunsil: "He's a guy. I think they've shuffled some guys back to their normal spots." 
-- On Ole Miss WR Laquon Treadwell: "Blocks, everything, physical, tough, competes at the top of routes." 
-- Will Carl Lawson will be back this week against Ole Miss: "I don't know. Coach will address that." 
--- More on Lawson: "His presence means a lot to our guys. He's certainly a leader on our team."
